description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
Instructor: Hei Yuen White Pak 白曦源

E-mail: vincent\_pak@hotmail.com

                                                                      **_English II (for Non-English Majors)_**

                                                                                        Spring, 2019

**Course Description:**

The second semester of this course aims to improve students’ English listening comprehension and communication competence along with reading literacy and raise their social and cultural awareness through various in-class and out-of-class activities.

**Textbook**

Dummet, Paul, Helen Stephenson and Lewis Lansford. _Keynote 3._ Boston: National Geographic Learning, 2017.

Readings prepared by the instructor

**Requirements and Rules**

1.  Class attendance, lesson preview, and active class participation are required. **Missing 4 classes** for any reason will result in an automatic F (0) for attendance and in-class participation.（以任何理由請假**4次（含）以上**，出席和課堂表現作0分論）
2.  Students are required to participate in group discussion, ask questions and answer questions raised by the instructor.（積極參與討論、提出及回答問題）
3.  Textbook is a must. Violation of this rule will **cost you 2 points** (out of your final score) each time.（忘記攜帶課本和講義**一次扣總分2分**）
4.  Read the assigned readings beforehand. （**課前先閱讀文章**）
5.  Plagiarism or cheating on quizzes or exams is absolutely forbidden. If someone is found cheating on an exam, that student will get an automatic F (0) for the class.
6.  For every English (II) class has been arranged an hour to take Lexile online reading comprehension post-test during 5/1-5/31. You can check out Lexile levelled books (Scholastic Inc.) from **2/F NTNU library** according to your own Lexile level (from 0L~1800L). Don’t forget to return the books to the library afterwards.

**Grading Policies**

1.     Attendance                                                                           20%

2.     In-class participation                                                              20%

3.     3-minute presentation (Oral + PPT + peer evaluation)                20%

4.     Final presentation (Oral + PPT + peer evaluation)                      20%

5.     In-class assignments (raising questions)                                  10%

6.     Lexile post-test                                                                      10%

**Bonus Points**

1.  Spending time on Self-Access English Center \[樸101 &102\], English Chat Room, Writing Center and 2/F NTNU library (**at most 3 points**)
2.  Participate in activities that help improve your English ability, such as three-minute presentation competition, listening to English talks, language exchange (**at most 3 points**)
